intro: Malmea guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan malmea, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in the spring. Malmea guatemalensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
